Repeat hematocrit showed it to be stable at 27 on 11/5 . It was thought that the drop in hematocrit was secondary to his chemotherapy , some small dilutional effect and small blood loss from the PTCA , although there was no evidence of significant bleeding . The patient was asymptomatic except for some back pain from lying flat after the catheterization procedures . His vital signs remained stable .
